cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with short-text classification, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The use of artificial neural networks (ANNs) also suggests a focus on machine learning. The specific approach of incorporating preceding short texts suggests a focus on sequential modeling. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. 

The use of ANNs also suggests a focus on machine learning, which could place the paper in sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The use of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and convolutional neural networks (CNNs) suggests a focus on deep learning, which could place the paper in sub-categories such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Finally, the use of short texts suggests a focus on information retrieval (IR), which could place the paper in sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
